Heading: Number of victims
Value: Harvey confessed to 87; however, he was only convicted of 36 murders, and one intentional manslaughter

Heading: XYY?
Value: Unknown – exudes many feminine characteristics and behaviors

Heading: Raised by
Value: Both parents – however, his grandmother and neighbors played a large part in raising him as well.

Heading: Parent’s marital status
Value: Separated for a short time when young, but reconciled shortly after.

Heading: Family event
Value: Separated due to abuse by both parties

Heading: Teased while in school?
Value: Yes – was called a sissy because all the girls liked him.

Heading: Physically attractive?
Value: Yes – was always obsessed with his looks.  He even went to the lengths of wearing dress clothes as a child to elementary school.

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: First was a tobacco farmer, then worked in a factory, and then as a door-fitter with Mosler Safe Company

Heading: Highest grade in school
Value: 9 – left school in order to accelerate his graduation (his principal noted this).

Heading: IQ
Value: Unknown – was noted how intelligent he is though.

Heading: Type of discharge
Value: Tried to commit suicide by overdosing on NyQuil.  Follow-up of that incident led to disclosure of his previous arrest and subsequent therapy in Kentucky.  Because he had concealed that history from the recruiter, he was discharged from the Air Force.  This was classified as medical, under honorable conditions.

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Factory worker very early, but then became a nursing assistant for most of his career.

Heading: Lives with his children
Value: No – there is some confusion on if they are his children or not

Heading: Living with
Value: One was adopted; one lives with mother.

Heading: Animal torture
Value: Hacked a chick in two with a hoe. (age 9)

Heading: Fire setting
Value: Set a fire in a bathroom of an empty apartment in the building where he lived because he was depressed.

Heading: Abused drugs?
Value: No – however did attempt suicide with over the counter drugs multiple times.  Used Deseryl, prescribed by his psychiatrist.

Heading: Been to a psychologist?
Value:
Yes – went to a psychiatrist three times after an arrest around age 19.  Later started receiving regular treatment by a 
psychiatrist (Dr. Mark Barbara) after becoming extremely depressed about his break-up with Carl.

Heading: Time in forensic hospital?
Value: Was in a psychiatric unit reserved for inmates while awaiting trial; however, did not serve time in one.

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value:
Was arrested for arson – paid a $50 fine. 
Was arrested for suspicion of burglary in his apartment 
building; the real reason for the arrest was to question Donald about the occult.

Heading: Killed prior to series?  Age?
Value: Killed for 18 years starting at age 18.  Prior to that, he did not kill anyone.

Heading: Number of victims
Value: Harvey confessed to 87; however, he was only convicted of 36 murders, and one intentional manslaughter

Heading: Victim type
Value: Elderly and ailing patients mostly; however, also killed people that he perceived as a danger to the life that he led.

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Method of killing
Value:
Smothering with plastic and pillow; poisoned with arsenic, cyanide, cleaning fluid, rat poison, Demerol, morphine, codeine; deprivation of oxygen using a faulty oxygen tank; attempted to use injections of HIV and hepatitis B 
unsuccessfully

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Either at his work or in neighborhood.

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Value: In some cases, but for the most part in the hospital in which he worked.

Heading: Killing occurred in home of killer?
Value: In some cases, but for the most part in the hospital in which he worked.

Heading: Weapon
Value: In some cases, he brought it with him (ex. poison); in other cases he found the weapon on the scene (ex. pillow)

Heading: Quick & efficient?
Value: Usually – sometimes it would take a few days for the victim to die, but for the most part they died quickly.

Heading: Took totem – body part
Value: No – however, did take blood and saliva.

Heading: Took totem – personal item
Value: Yes – for example: cookies, which he ate during an occult ceremony; a knitted pair of booties; a lap blanket; a lock of hair which he burned during an occult ceremony

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Did killer plead NGRI?
Value: No – did not meet the criteria for NGRI

Heading: Killer committed suicide?
Value: Attempted during his depressions of his youth.
